doc.title: One-Eye, Two-Eyes, and Three-Eyes
doc.text: There was once a woman who had three sons, the eldest of whom was called One-eye, because he had only one eye in the middle of her forehead, and the second, Two-eyes, because he had two eyes like other folks, and the youngest, Three-eyes, because he had three eyes; and her third eye was also in the centre of her forehead. However, as Two-eyes saw just as other human beings did, her brothers and her mother could not endure her. ....
